summary: A player house inspired by one of the crafting area's in ESO. This magical playerhouse is being rewarded to the dragonborn for purging the necromancer that defiles Meridia's temple, and thus allowing you to live in her Realm; The Colored Rooms.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#38761d][size=4]REQUIRES Dawnguard,Heartfire,Dragonborn and the General Display MOD![/size][/color]

[size=6]Welcome Dragonborn, into my Realm. [/size]

[/font][size=2]For cle[color=#f4f4f4]ansing my temple, a[/color]nd destroying the vile necromancer [/size][size=2]Malkoran, I grant you my artifact; Dawnbringer. [/size][size=2]Take the mighty Dawnbreaker and with it purge corruption from the dark corners of the world. Wield it in my name, that my influence may grow." For doing this, I shall grant you a place you can call home,[/size][b] [size=3]into my Realm; The Colored Rooms[/size][size=2].[/size][/b][size=2] - Here you can store the most dangerous artifacts and your valuables safely, for none but you can enter. May my realm's beauty inspire you, Dragonborn. [/size][size=1]- Meridia[/size]


[size=3]The colored rooms is a playerhouse that is inspired by one of the crafting area's in The Elderscrolls Online. [/size][color=#ff0000]The Colored Rooms can be accessed infront of Meridia's Shrine at Kilkreath. There is a portal stone there that you can use after obtaining the key in the room where you would fight the necromancer Malkoran and obtain Dawnbreaker.[/color][color=#f4f4f4][size=2][b] [/b]If the key is somehow unobtainable you can always unlock the stone or simply cheat the key.[/size][/color]


[size=3]The house stands in a cave which is totally safe to use for any kind of storage. It has a lot of costum storage and I find it to believe it is very lorefriendly. Do note due to the extreme hard work and placement, not all computers might be able to handle a mod like this, I have no problem at all running it myself, but I can imagine that some pc's will have.

The house contains:
1: Living space/kitchen
2: A crafting area for enchanting, smithing, alchemy and spiderscroll crafting
3: A bedroom
4: A Garden with 7 planters to grow your own alchemy ingredients.
5: A secret door in the bedroom that leads to a costum storage room.
6: A beautiful vieuw!
7: A lot of costum storage
8: Obiously normal storage aswell.
9: A weapon  displays (arround 15) 
10: NO MANNEQUINS, I can't stand it that they have a chance to move, so no.[color=#ff0000] -NEVER-[/color]

[color=#f4f4f4]

The following items have their own storage displays
1: All thieves guild treasure's. ( Living room, the wooden boat can be placed above the fireplace, burst at the desk area upstairs. and both the eyes in the secret costum display room)
2: All dragonmasks and DragonbornDLC masks.( secret room)
3: Most daedric artifacts. (secret room)
4: All claws and the DragonbornDLC claw ( Secret room)
5: The initiate's ewer ( I love it!, can be placed at the dining area on a sidetable)
6: Haelga's Dibella Statue ( Can be placed at the dining area on a sidetable)
7: The two candlesticks that belong to the mold ( Can be placed at the dining area on a sidetable)
8: Pelagius's Hipbone ( beneath the Elderscrolls in the secret room)
9: The 5 paragons from Dawnguard ( secret room)
10: The three Elderscrolls (secret room)
11: Auriel's bow (pedestal in secret room)
12: -
13: The 4 falmer books from Dawnguard DLC ( English translation, can be placed in the dining room on a sidetable)
14: Kolbjorn's Skull from Dragonborn DLC (can be placed on the empty table next to the entrance door)
15: The two skull keys (can be placed on the empty table next to the entrance door)
16: All 7 blackbooks from Dragonborn DLC ( secret room)
17: Dreamstride + Boethia's calling + Opium Infinium book, ( Can be placed at the enchanting area)
18: All 4 Mythic Dawn Commentaries ( Can be placed at the enchanting area)
19: All critters in a jar ( can be placed on a side table at the alchemy station)
20: The white Phial (can be placed on a small sidetable next to the alchemy station) [/color][/size]


[color=#ff0000]The house is navmeshed but there are no extra beds for followers, nor do I feel like I want to create such in the near future.

[b][u]I stand open for idea's but I find this house finished. I don't want the space to get laggy, it is pretty on the limit at this moment.[/u][/b][/color]


[b]SPECIAL THANKS TO [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3231858]Elianora[/url] FOR HELPING ME REGARDING CUSTOM DISPLAY, I SUGGEST YOU CHECK HER AWESOME MODS!!!!!
SPECIAL THANKS TO [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/17279409]MrDanSG1[/url] FOR HIS AWESOME COSTUM DISPLAY SCRIPTS.[/b]

[size=4]
I WOULD LIKE TO THANK THE FOLLOWING PEOPLE FOR CREATING AWESOME SCRIPTS AND MESHES THAT HELPED ME TO CREATE MY MOD[/size]

I hope you all will enjoy my mod, I DO :) 

Please leave a comment, I love to read them! 
Please Endorse if you like it, it makes me very happy, I spend over 30 hours into this mod.

Greetings,

MrKoekie

[color=#38761d][size=5]Need a place for your vampire? Check my other mod; Tomb of Pelagius. 
[/size][/color]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64213/?
